text: HIRTEENTH UNDAY IN RDINARY IME UNE 27 2021 This weekend June 26th 27th the Church celebrates the Thirteenth Sunday in Ordinary Time Our local Church however is also celebrating the fiftyfifth anniversary of the dedication of our churchbuilding To mark this celebration our bulletin features a retrocover This cover designed by parishioner Nancy Wagner served as one of our primary bulletin covers during the 1980s This celebration reminds us both of our past and our future It is our story the vibrant epic of the way in which the life of God is nourished in our souls It begins in the churchbuilding as the expectant mother prays for a blessing upon her newly conceived child It ends in the churchbuilding as the mourning family gathers to pray for their departed loved one During all the years in between filled with work and rest joy and sorrow pleasure and pain we gather together to pray as one in the churchbuilding ULY AILY ASS CHEDULE This week I received my class information for our July Semester at the Catholic University of America Due to a change in my class schedule we will once again have a change in our daily Mass schedule throughout July On Thursday July 1st daily Mass will be at 5:30PM On Friday July 2nd daily Mass will be at 12:30PM with adoration from 100600 PM and our First Friday Votive Mass at 6:00PM Starting on July 6th our schedule throughout July will be Tuesdays Thursdays and Fridays Daily Mass at 5:30PM Wednesdays Daily Mass at 7:00PM Saturdays Daily Mass at 8:00AM Adoration and Confession will be on Wednesdays from 600700 PM prior to the 7:00PM Mass As always thank you for your understanding and flexibility IOCESAN ISSION PEAKER OSE We will welcome Fr Jose Panamattathil VC as the celebrant at all of our liturgies next weekend Many may know Fr Jose as the associate pastor of St Marys Decatur He is also a religious priest being a missionary of the Vincentian Congregation This congregation founded November 20 1904 in Kerala South India draws its spirit and distinctive character from the life works and the Common Rules of their patron St Vincent De Paul Fr Jose will be our diocesan mission speaker this year Next weekend he will have the opportunity to share with us the good work that his community is doing including evangelization in parish missions providing education through local schools creating local publications and founding various rehabilitation centers throughout North India and East Africa These good works could not continue without our prayers and our financial support With the adverse effects of the coronavirus the Vincentians in India are also facing many additional challenges in their ministry The second wave of the pandemic within India has left many hospitalized including many Vincentian priests in Fr Joses own congregation Our financial support of Fr Joses mission will not only aide the good work that the Vincentians have been doing over the past many years but will also be put towards relief work for those families suffering from the coronavirus in North India special second collection basket will be set aside our normal offertory basket when entering the Church next weekend Donations placed in this second basket will be put towards the missionary work of the Vincentians I know that our parish will generously respond to supporting the work of the Vincentians in North India as they preach the Good News of Jesus Christ Faithfully in Christ Fr David MASS INTENTIONS Saturday June 26 8:00am Special Intention 400445 pm Confession 4:35pm Rosary 5:00pm Lloyd Viola
